segment.source: Memory Footprint Optimization
segment.target: Memory Footprint Optimization

segment.source: The amount of memory available on a system significantly impacts the user experience.
segment.target: The amount of memory available on a system significantly impacts the user experience.

segment.source: Memory Footprint Optimization
segment.target: Memory Footprint Optimization

segment.source: The amount of memory available on a system significantly impacts the user experience.
segment.target: The amount of memory available on a system significantly impacts the user experience.

segment.source: The impact affects areas ranging from the overall responsiveness of the system to battery life.
segment.target: The impact affects areas ranging from the overall responsiveness of the system to battery life.

segment.source: Available memory is an important factor to consider when evaluating the complete experience on a low memory device where Windows relies heavily on paging and swapping of content from memory.
segment.target: Available memory is an important factor to consider when evaluating the complete experience on a low memory device where Windows relies heavily on paging and swapping of content from memory.

segment.source: This guide walks you through the process of analyzing memory-related performance issues and identifying the root cause, whether it’s a driver or a user mode process, using the Windows Performance Toolkit.
segment.target: This guide walks you through the process of analyzing memory-related performance issues and identifying the root cause, whether it’s a driver or a user mode process, using the Windows Performance Toolkit.

segment.source: Topics include:
segment.target: Topics include:

segment.source: Driver and application footprint
segment.target: Driver and application footprint

segment.source: Working Sets and Resident Sets
segment.target: Working Sets and Resident Sets

segment.source: Pool memory allocations
segment.target: Pool memory allocations

segment.source: Heap and VirtualAlloc memory allocations
segment.target: Heap and VirtualAlloc memory allocations

segment.source: Goals
segment.target: Goals

segment.source: This guide will show you how to perform the following tasks:
segment.target: This guide will show you how to perform the following tasks:

segment.source: Use Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) to gather traces of memory-related issues.
segment.target: Use Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) to gather traces of memory-related issues.

segment.source: Use the Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) Memory Footprint assessment to gather a memory usage baseline.
segment.target: Use the Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) Memory Footprint assessment to gather a memory usage baseline.

segment.source: Analyze paged/non-paged pool memory usage by drivers.
segment.target: Analyze paged/non-paged pool memory usage by drivers.

segment.source: Analyze working sets and resident sets of processes.
segment.target: Analyze working sets and resident sets of processes.

segment.source: Understand how and when memory is dynamically allocated by drivers and processes.
segment.target: Understand how and when memory is dynamically allocated by drivers and processes.

segment.source: Tools
segment.target: Tools

segment.source: In the past, a kernel debugger along with a large number of cryptic commands had to be used to discover what data and file pages currently occupy physical memory.
segment.target: In the past, a kernel debugger along with a large number of cryptic commands had to be used to discover what data and file pages currently occupy physical memory.

segment.source: Now, you can use the Windows Performance Toolkit (WPT) to collect and display this information in a more understandable and actionable manner through built-in Windows instrumentation.
segment.target: Now, you can use the Windows Performance Toolkit (WPT) to collect and display this information in a more understandable and actionable manner through built-in Windows instrumentation.

segment.source: WPT consists of the Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) and the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).
segment.target: WPT consists of the Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) and the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit in the ADK can also be used to obtain a memory footprint assessment.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit in the ADK can also be used to obtain a memory footprint assessment.

segment.source: This assessment creates a snapshot of memory use during a series of system reboots and immediately after the desktop is visible.
segment.target: This assessment creates a snapshot of memory use during a series of system reboots and immediately after the desktop is visible.

segment.source: It does not evaluate memory use during ordinary computer operations.
segment.target: It does not evaluate memory use during ordinary computer operations.

segment.source: The ADK Windows Assessment Console (WAC) is the tool used to run assessments and generate visual performance reports.
segment.target: The ADK Windows Assessment Console (WAC) is the tool used to run assessments and generate visual performance reports.

segment.source: Terminology
segment.target: Terminology

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Definition
segment.target: Definition

segment.source: Sharable pages
segment.target: Sharable pages

segment.source: Pages that one or more processes can use.
segment.target: Pages that one or more processes can use.

segment.source: Examples include code pages within executable images (.dll, .exe, and .cpl) or data file pages (.txt, .doc, etc.).
segment.target: Examples include code pages within executable images (.dll, .exe, and .cpl) or data file pages (.txt, .doc, etc.).

segment.source: Private pages
segment.target: Private pages

segment.source: Pages used exclusively by a single process and most commonly contain dynamically allocated data such as Heap or VirtualAlloc.
segment.target: Pages used exclusively by a single process and most commonly contain dynamically allocated data such as Heap or VirtualAlloc.

segment.source: Process Working Set
segment.target: Process Working Set

segment.source: Set of pages recently referenced by a process and contains both private and shared pages.
segment.target: Set of pages recently referenced by a process and contains both private and shared pages.

segment.source: Process Private Working Set
segment.target: Process Private Working Set

segment.source: Set of private non-sharable pages recently referenced by a process.
segment.target: Set of private non-sharable pages recently referenced by a process.

segment.source: Available
segment.target: Available

segment.source: Amount of memory immediately available for use by processes on the system.
segment.target: Amount of memory immediately available for use by processes on the system.

segment.source: This metric is composed of pages on the Standby list that do not need to be written to persistent storage before they can be repurposed by other processes.
segment.target: This metric is composed of pages on the Standby list that do not need to be written to persistent storage before they can be repurposed by other processes.

segment.source: Exercises
segment.target: Exercises

segment.source: This guide consists of the following exercises.
segment.target: This guide consists of the following exercises.

segment.source: Exercise 1 - Identify Processes with Large Working Sets
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Identify Processes with Large Working Sets

segment.source: Exercise 2 - Track User Mode Process Allocations
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Track User Mode Process Allocations

segment.source: Exercise 3 - Track Driver Footprint and Dynamic Allocations During Boot
segment.target: Exercise 3 - Track Driver Footprint and Dynamic Allocations During Boot
